Boston Film Screening and Live Show: Bombino & Agadez
Agadez, the Music and the Rebellion – a film that features the music of the extraordinary Tuareg musician ‘Bombino’ – will be playing at the Brattle Cinema in Cambridge on Tuesday, July 12 at 7:30. Bombino will be playing a concert at the Brighton Music Hall on July 14!

Learn more at Zero Gravity Films

In Agadez, The Music And The Rebellion, documentary film-maker Ron Wyman has done an excellent job of not only depicting life in the desert of Niger without romanticizing or sentimentalizing it, but showing what people are doing to preserve it in the face of increasingly difficult odds.

Follow his camera into one of the harshest environments on earth and meet the people who not only live there, but cherish the freedom it brings them. You will also meet the remarkable young musician, Omara “Bombino” Moctar, whose story of exile and return is typical for his generation, but whose talent is unique.

Descendants of the Berber tribes of North Africa Bombino’s people were named Tuareg, Arabic for rebels, for their initial resistance to adopting the Muslim faith, but refer to themselves as the Kel Tamsheq after their language. The life of the Kel Tamsheq is not easy, but it is the life they have chosen to live and desire to keep on living in as much as the modern world will allow them to do so.
